intro: Echium cossyrense, commonly known as the Canary Island fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, playing a role in local ecosystems. Echium cossyrense is often found in open habitats with well-drained soils, showcasing its resilience and ecological significance.
